pr_title: [FLINK-18545] Introduce `pipeline.name` to allow users to specify job name by configuration

timeline.message: [FLINK-18545][table] Specify job name by `pipeline.name` for sql job

timeline.author: twalthr
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1778,7 +1778,7 @@ private StateBackend loadStateBackend(ReadableConfig configuration, ClassLoader
 	 * @throws Exception which occurs during job execution.
 	 */
 	public JobExecutionResult execute() throws Exception {

timeline.bodyText: nit: simplify the test here and below to just use env.fromElements(1, 2, 3).print()
timeline.author: twalthr

timeline.bodyText: Can't we just put the default name in the pipeline option? That way, it will also be rendered in the documentation.
timeline.author: aljoscha

replies.bodyText: Are pipeline options also used in ExecutionEnvironment? The PR doesn't update this class but maybe it should? In that case Flink Streaming Job would be wrong.
replies.author: twalthr

replies.bodyText: Thanks all for the suggestions. @twalthr, I have checked that the pipeline options are also used in ExecutionEnvironment. I also don't notice that before, I will update it. The default name of ExecutionEnvironment is "Flink Java Job at " + Calendar.getInstance().getTime(), so the NAME option has no default value.
replies.author: godfreyhe

replies.bodyText: TableEnvironment also uses a different default name for the SQL query, e.g. insert-into_<sink-names>. So I think no default value makes more sense, that the default value is defined by different environment.
replies.author: wuchong

timeline.bodyText: This method must not be public and thus part of the API. You can call createProgramPlan().getJobName for testing.
timeline.author: twalthr
